Package src.atm.account

Class BankAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.atm.account.Account
      • src.atm.account.BankAccount
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SavingsAccount

    public class BankAccount
extends Account
    This class provides methods and functionality for users to have bank accounts that can store their balances and make deposits, withdrawals, or transfers.

    This class inherits src.atm.account.Account.
    Version:
    01/30/2018
    Author:
    Joshua Ciffer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      (package private) java.math.BigDecimal accountBalance
      Stores the user's account balance saved to two significant decimal places.
      (package private) static java.text.NumberFormat US_DOLLARS
      Used to format currency values from a numerical data type to a formatted string with the pattern $XXX.XX.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BankAccount

        public BankAccount​(java.lang.String accountName,
                   Pin accountPin,
                   java.math.BigDecimal accountBalance)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Opens a new bank account with the user's name, PIN, and starting balance. Upon calling the constructor in Account, this account is added to the account map. If any of the parameters are not valid, the account is closed and removed from the account map.
        Parameters:
        accountName - - The account holder's name.
        accountPin - - The user's 4 digit PIN.
        accountBalance - - The account's starting balance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if a negative amount is entered for the account's balance.

    • Method Detail

      • TO_CURRENCY_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String TO_CURRENCY_FORMAT​(double amount)
        Formats a numerical amount into a USD currency format.

        This method cannot be overridden.
        Parameters:
        amount - - The number to be formatted.
        Returns:
        A string in USD currency format.

      • TO_CURRENCY_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String TO_CURRENCY_FORMAT​(java.math.BigDecimal amount)
        Formats a numerical amount into a USD currency format.

        This method cannot be overridden.
        Parameters:
        amount - - The number to be formatted.
        Returns:
        A string in USD currency format.

      • IS_POSITIVE_AMOUNT

        public static final boolean IS_POSITIVE_AMOUNT​(double amount)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Performs a check to see if the user has entered a positive amount for any currency values.

        This method cannot be overridden.
        Parameters:
        amount - - The amount to check if positive.
        Returns:
        True - If the amount is greater than zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the amount is less than zero.

      • hasSufficientBalance

        public final boolean hasSufficientBalance​(double amount)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Performs a check to see if the user has a sufficient balance to complete a transaction.

        This method cannot be overridden.
        Parameters:
        amount - - The amount to see if the user has in their account balance.
        Returns:
        - True if the user has enough money in their balance to complete a transaction.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the amount the user needs is greater than their balance.

      • transfer

        public void transfer​(int receivingAccount,
                     double transferAmount)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.NullPointerException
        User chooses another account to send money to. Money is withdrawn from their account and deposited in the account they specify.
        Parameters:
        receivingAccount - - The account to receive the money.
        transferAmount - - The amount of money to transfer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the user enters a negative amount of money to transfer, or they have an insufficient balance.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the account the user wants to transfer money to does not exist.

      • deposit

        public void deposit​(double depositAmount)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Deposits a specified amount of money into the user's account.
        Parameters:
        depositAmount - - The amount to deposit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the deposit amount is negative.

      • withdraw

        public void withdraw​(double withdrawalAmount)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Withdrawals a specified amount of money from the user's account.
        Parameters:
        withdrawalAmount - - The amount to withdrawal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the withdrawal amount is negative or the user has an insufficient balance.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object bankAccount)
        Compares the contents of two bank account objects to test for equality.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
